remarks: Product of exponents law for complex exponentiation.  Variation on ~ cxpmul with more general conditions on ` A ` and ` B ` when ` C ` is an integer.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.)
statement: cxpmul2 $p |- ( ( A e. CC /\ B e. CC /\ C e. NN0 ) -> ( A ^c ( B x. C ) ) = ( ( A ^c B ) ^ C ) ) $.
